page.title: 10SCHOOL HISTORY
page.content: This school was built in 1869 replacing one built in 1827. It is a lovely sandstone building, and we like it very much. The original old doors and roof beams look nice. We have the original plans from the County record office and found that the Infant and Junior rooms used to be cloakrooms. A village lady remembers 57 yrs. ago when the toilets were earth closets in the garden and the children had to go out in the rain to use them. We found there used to be fixed benches and raised teachers' desks in the classrooms and that the middle classroom was quite small but later extended. There were open fireplaces in all the rooms. The children went home for dinner or ate their sandwiches in the garden.co
